author: .fjl
content: yes I agree we should have something related to subscriptions

author: .fjl
content: OpenRPC can't specify eth_subscribe right now

author: .fjl
content: the feature request you linked kind of matches one of the points I tried to raise in the doc: there will sometimes be feature requests which are really hard to implement without some sort of deep indexing in the client. for this particular one, in geth, we would need to attach a tracer to all block processing to catch these updates

author: robocopsgonemad
content: pretty much same here, but thats just a plugin for us

author: robocopsgonemad
content: would receipts filtering and subscription be easier to implement?

author: .fjl
content: yeah that's easier because we already have a system for receipt events (the log filtering)

author: .fjl
content: for purposes of standardization, requests which are hard to implement can be a problem. I don't think we'll ever agree among all clients on the details of a new subscription like this. It's just too much.

author: .fjl
content: that said, we have gotten pretty far already with what's there

author: robocopsgonemad
content: in that case, i think there might still be value in spec'ing it out but leaving it as optional. that way RPC providers can rely on all clients that DO support it, doing so consistently, and they can just route around the ones that don't.

author: .fjl
content: so you would say the profiles are a good idea?

author: .fjl
content: then there would also be the question who gets to decide on these proposals

author: robocopsgonemad
content: yes, i like the idea of profiles. would like to hear more about how they differ from a namespace
